frameDefinitions: An Agent or Cause limits a Range_of_options to having a certain Characteristic.

This frame consists of words that indicate that an Agent or a Cause affects the position of an Item on some scale (the Attribute) to change it from an initial value (Value_1) to an end value (Value_2).
A Supplier gives a Theme to a Recipient to fulfill a need or purpose (Imposed_purpose) of the Recipient.
An  Agent or non-human Cause causes an Item to change its physical size.
An Item changes its physical size.

A Theme changes location with respect to a salient location, which can be expressed by a Source, Path, Goal, Area, Direction, Path_shape, or Distance, as shown in the examples below: ''  'Start your ascent from Achintree Farm in Glen Nevis.'
frameExamples: His choices in life have <t>limited</t> his opportunities severely.
The company is <t>raising</t> the final dividend from 4.34p to 4.57p, to boost the total by 5.3 percent to 6.36p.
Habituating the ground nesting chimp groups is done by <t>provisioning</t> them with sugar cane. CNI INI
If the design crashes too often, then try <t>lengthening</t> the wings by a few centimeters, to perhaps 30cm total.  CNI INI
The pile of leaves had <t>shrunk</t> by about half after the first haul.
Start your <t>ascent</t> from Achintree Farm in Glen Nevis.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Agent</fen> consciously places limits upon the Range_of_options.
The <fen>Cause</fen> is a natural occurrence or state-of-affairs that limits the Range_of_options.

The <fen>Range_of_options</fen> would normally be expected to have a set of possibilites, but is limited by an <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen> to particular subtypes, situations or characteristics.
The <fen>Characteristic</fen> indicates the subtypes or situations to which the <fen>Range_of_options</fen> is limited.
The time at which the limiting takes place.
The location in which the <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen> limits the <fen>Range_of_options</fen>.
The person who causes an entity (Item) to change its positon on a scale with respect to some property (Variable).
The scale along which the <fen>Item</fen> ranges in value.
The entity whose position along a scale is being changed.
The force that causes the change.
When the event occurs.
The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> changes the value of an <fen>Attribute</fen>.
The person that begins in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen> and causes it to be in the possession of the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
The entity that ends up in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The object that is given to the <fen>Recipient</fen> .
The <fen>Recipient</fen>'s intended purpose for the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Supplier</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Supplier</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
With some words in this frame, an <fen>Agent</fen> who causes the change in size of the <fen>Item</fen> may be present. The <fen>Agent</fen> typically occurs as the External Argument of a verb.
The <fen>Item</fen> is frequently the External Argument of verbs or the NP Object if an <fen>Agent</fen> is expressed.
The <fen>Cause</fen> is a non-human entity which brings about the change in size.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> causes the <fen>Item</fen> to expand.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Agent</fen> cause the expansion of the <fen>Item</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Item</fen> whose size changes.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the expansion occurs.

This is the object which moves. In many sentences this role will be expressed as something which moves under its own power. However, this role is not <ment>required</ment> to be an animate mover, so it is different from Self_mover.

Any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion expresses the frame element <fen>Source</fen>. In prepositional phrases, the prepositional object expresses the starting point of motion. In particles, the starting point of motion is understood from context.
Any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a <fen>Source</fen> nor a <fen>Goal</fen> (see below) expresses the frame element <fen>Path</fen>, including directional expressions:
Any expression which tells where the <fen>Theme</fen> ends up as a result of the motion expresses the frame element Goal.
Any expression which characterizes the extent of motion expresses the frame element <fen>Distance</fen>.
This frame element is used for expressions which describe a general area in which motion takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular and not to consist of a single linear path.
The configuration formed by the entire <fen>Path</fen> of the <fen>Theme</fen>, taken simultaneously.
The direction in which the <fen>Theme</fen> goes.
The time at which the motion takes place.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the motion (which is specified by a <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen> or <fen>Goal</fen>) is located.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The military</fex> limited building access to key personnel.
<fex>Ongoing rains</fex> have limited drivers to a small number of roads.
The military limited <fex>building access</fex> to key personnel.
The military limited access <fex>to key personnel only</fex>.
Banks are <fex>currently</fex> limiting customers to two cash transactions per day.
They increased <fex>the price of oil</fex>.
<fex>Oil</fex> prices were raised yesterday.
<fex>The rain</fex> increased the river's flow rate to an astonishing million gallons per second.
As a result, they raised prices <fex>in Peoria</fex>.
I approve of <fex>your</fex> having supplied him with a file of soldiers.
VESID also supplied <fex>him</fex> with an all zone bus pass to help him travel to interviews.

Cromwell merged men from multiple regiments into a single one and provisioned
them <fex>with red uniforms</fex> to replace their former regiment colors.
God gave them the promise of victory and equipped them <fex>for the battle</fex>.
In Breidbach, water tankers were <fex>yesterday</fex> supplied to the community as the main water supply pipe had been washed away.

The Harpley was launched in Launceston on the 2nd February, 1847, and with the exception
of her chain cables, was <fex>there</fex> supplied with all her materials and stores.
<fex>Management</fex> expanded the company.
<fex>The company</fex> expanded.
<fex>Joan's new sweater</fex> shrank to a size that might fit a doll.
<fex>Kim</fex> crossed through the woods.
The cat crossed the street <fex>from her yard</fex>.
The bikers crisscrossed <fex>through the desert</fex>.
The children hopped <fex>into the neighbor's yard</fex>.
I leaped <fex>twenty feet</fex> before slipping and falling.
The bikers crisscrossed <fex>the desert</fex>.
He circled downward <fex>in a spiral</fex>.
The frogs jumped <fex>down</fex> through the meadow.
They crisscrossed the country <fex>in April</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the House Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence
